comments:
I200409200800, self-hosted Platform UI from head, Windows XP (service pack 1). 
 
I just saw this printed to the console, but there was no visible side effect, 
and I don't know what triggered it. 
 
 
java.lang.NullPointerException 
 at 
org.eclipse.ui.editors.text.TextFileDocumentProvider.<init>(TextFileDocumentProvider.java:384) 
 at 
org.eclipse.ui.editors.text.TextFileDocumentProvider.<init>(TextFileDocumentProvider.java:369) 
 at 
org.eclipse.jdt.internal.ui.javaeditor.CompilationUnitDocumentProvider.<init>(CompilationUnitDocumentProvider.java:772) 
 at 
org.eclipse.jdt.internal.ui.JavaPlugin.getCompilationUnitDocumentProvider(JavaPlugin.java:516) 
 at 
org.eclipse.jdt.internal.ui.text.JavaCompositeReconcilingStrategy.getProblemRequestorExtension(JavaCompositeReconcilingStrategy.java:63) 
 at 
org.eclipse.jdt.internal.ui.text.JavaCompositeReconcilingStrategy.initialReconcile(JavaCompositeReconcilingStrategy.java:118) 
 at 
org.eclipse.jface.text.reconciler.MonoReconciler.initialProcess(MonoReconciler.java:103) 
 at 
org.eclipse.jdt.internal.ui.text.JavaReconciler.initialProcess(JavaReconciler.java:304) 
 at 
org.eclipse.jface.text.reconciler.AbstractReconciler$BackgroundThread.run(AbstractReconciler.java:170)

What Vm are you running? 


This seems to be an 'impossible' problem. The line that throws the NPE is

fResourceRuleFactory= ResourcesPlugin.getWorkspace().getRuleFactory();

The NPE could happen when the workspace is null. This is prohibited by the 
ResourcesPlugin. It would throw an IllegalStateException in that case.

Sun's JDK 1.4.2 VM. 
 
This does seem somewhat impossible.  Either a bug in the OSGI layer, or a bug 
in the VM itself.

I just encountered this bug myself. I eliminated the npe by removing the line
"if (myVar == null)"... that seems pretty strange. If you're still looking for a
reproducible test case, I can give you one.
Sure. Please provide the test case.
